name: Process Surgeon
description: A cross-platform network port and process management utility for developers. Eliminates the need to memorize command-line tools like lsof or netstat with a powerful graphical interface.
features: Discover which applications are using specific network ports
Gracefully terminate processes (SIGTERM) or force-kill them (SIGKILL)
Real-time monitoring with configurable refresh intervals
Docker container management capabilities
Quick port search functionality with keyboard shortcuts
Favorite/pin commonly monitored ports
Action history with timestamps
Export data as JSON or CSV formats
Advanced filtering by name, PID, port, protocol, and connection state
Right-click context menu support

tiers.name: Free
features: Open source (MIT License)
All features included
Cross-platform support
No restrictions

name: Log Microscope
description: High-performance desktop application for analyzing large log files. Leverages memory-mapped file access and parallel processing to handle gigabyte-scale logs efficiently with smooth 60 FPS scrolling.
features: Memory-mapped file access - open multi-gigabyte logs instantly
Parallel regex search with SIMD optimizations
SQL query support via Apache DataFusion engine
Virtualized rendering maintains 60 FPS through millions of lines
Recent files - quick access to last 7 opened files
Word wrap toggle for long log entries
Dark theme for extended debugging sessions
Fast pattern matching using Rust's rayon and memchr
No need to load entire files into memory

tiers.name: Free
features: Open source (MIT License)
Unlimited log file size
All features included
Cross-platform support
